instructions:
In a saucepan combine onion, garlic and water; bring to boiling and reduce heat. Cover and cook about 2
minutes or until tender. Stir in undrained tomatoes, olives, lime juice, peppers and sugar. Return to boiling;
reduce heat and simmer covered for 5 minutes. Uncover and simmer for 10 minutes. Meanwhile, place
fillets in a 9 x 13 inch baking dish. Spoon sauce on top of fillets. Bake in a 450-degree oven for 8 to 10
minutes. Serves 4.
ingredients: 1 lb Red Snapper (or Boston Blue) fillets
1/3 cup sliced pitted green or ripe olives
1 to 2 tsp chopped canned jalapeno peppers
name: Red Snapper Veracruz
